basic.description: This course is a study of the operations and administration of commercial banks and their role in the money and capital markets. Examines banking regulation, the lending function, investments, and the financial decision-making process.
basic.subject: FIN
basic.title: Commercial Bank Administration

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisites: CGS 2518, FIN 3244, and FIN 3403 with a grade of "B-" or better.
